etymologies: late Middle English: via Old French from Arabic zaytūnī ‘of Tsinkiang’, a town in China

definitions: a smooth, glossy fabric, usually of silk, produced by a weave in which the threads of the warp are caught and looped by the weft only at certain intervals

examples.text: flowing skirts made of satin, chiffon, and velvet

shortDefinitions: smooth, glossy fabric, usually of silk

definitions: denoting or having a surface or finish resembling satin

examples.text: an aluminum alloy with a black satin finish

shortDefinitions: denoting or having surface or finish resembling this fabric, produced on metal or other material
